main event: A fast-moving, pulsating, elliptical object with flashing red and green lights was observed by Air Force radar in the North Pacific on August 23, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as changing shape due to wind velocity distortions, with varying white-yellow color.
The object hovered horizontally for 10 minutes before rapidly ascending vertically and disappearing to the east.
The object did not leave a trail and made no sound.
The report concluded the sighting was a possible bolide (a type of meteorite) observation.
A separate document describes a similar object observed on October 2, 1958, which was estimated to be 10-12 feet in diameter, moving at 700-800 knots with abrupt turns and rapid altitude changes.
sighted object: fast-moving, pulsating, elliptical object with flashing red and green lights
